Afghan officials say voting will extend into a second day in parliamentary elections after delays in some districts on Saturday Jennifer glass reports from Kabul on the chaotic start to the long awaited elections
Many polling stations in Afghanistan like this cobble middle school had a technical logistical problems that delayed voting or prevented altogether polling centers that couldn't operate today are set to open Sunday the latest complication in a parliamentary election that was supposed to take place three years ago
In Kabul they've been a number of exclusion and the Taliban and Islamic state threatened voters to stay away but despite problems that included flawed voter lived in long lines many Afghans appear determined to cast their ballot thing they'll wait as long as it takes for NPR News I'm Jennifer glass in Kabul

The Trump Administration is trying to speed an environmental review of western projects that deliver federally subsidized water to farmers NPR's Kirk Siegler reports a new memorandum from the president's aims to loosen environmental restrictions in western states
Republicans going back to the George W. Bush administration has tried to increase water deliveries to farmers in California's massive Central Valley project where water from snow fed reservoirs gets pumped south to arid farmland but this deliveries are perennially cut back due to attempts to protect endangered fish and throughout
The president's order would speed up the current review of this as well as to other projects in Oregon and Washington
Is environmental restrictions are loose and there will likely be a pro long legal battle and one of the biggest champions of this latest plan is deputy interior secretary David Bernhardt used to lobby for the Fresno based west ones water district one of the largest and most influential water agencies and the west Kirk Siegler NPR News
To tropical storms are swirling in the Pacific ocean off Mexico and one is forecast to become a hurricane and approach the country's west coast in the coming week
Tropical storm willow is the twenty first name storm of the Eastern Pacific hurricane season
The national Hurricane Center said it was likely to remain well off the coast through Wednesday when it could approach Mexico's west central mainland as a hurricane tropical storm the Sunday foreign friday off the coast of the southern state of Kiev as it could produce three to six inches of rain along Mexico's southern Pacific coast and parts of
Guatemala I'm Jim Huck NPR News in Washington
